ELECTRONICALLY FILED
12/20/2024 3:07 PM
70-DR-2023-900051.01
CIRCUIT COURT OF
TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
PATRICK CRADDOCK, CLERK
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR,
Respondent,
v.
CASE NO.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND,
Petitioner.
MOTION TO MODIFY CHILD SUPPORT
DUE TO FATHER’S CONTEMPT IN NONPAYMENT
COMES NOW, Petitioner BRITTANY GILLILAND, by and through the undersigned
counsel of record, Barbara H. Agricola, with the law firm of Agricola Law, LLC, and files this
Motion to Modify Child Support Due to Father’s Contempt in Nonpayment. In support thereof,
Petitioner states as follows:
1. On September 20, 2024, Respondent filed for Chapter 13 bankruptcy in Case No.: 24-
81152 and informed Petitioner he would no longer pay Petitioner her equity payments,
as ordered in the Parties’ Final Decree of Divorce in Case No.: 70-DR-900051.00 [Doc.
156];
2. A confirmation hearing in the Respondent’s bankruptcy case occurred on December
11, 2024. Due to Respondent filing bankruptcy, Petitioner will not begin to see
repayment of Respondent’s debt to her for at least two years;
3. Even more concerning, Respondent had contacted DHR at the time of filing for
bankruptcy in September 2024, in order to garnish Petitioner’s wages so she would
remain obligated to pay for the full amount of child support currently ordered, despite
Brittany Michelle Gilliland v. Christopher Blaine McGregor
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County, Alabama
Case No.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
Motion to Modify Child Support
Page 1 of 3
DOCUMENT 99
a significant reduction in monthly income due solely to Respondent’s actions in gaming
the legal system;
4. Petitioner was awarded monthly payments of $2,000.00 from the equity in the Parties’
marital residence. Since these payments ceased in September, there is a significant
decrease in Petitioner’s monthly income and child support is due to be suspended or
recalculated as a result;
5. Petitioner has incurred attorney’s fees in filing this Motion due solely to Respondent’s
actions.
WHEREFORE, PREMISES CONSIDERED, the Petitioner respectfully requests that
this Honorable Court GRANT this Motion to recalculate Petitioner’s child support in accordance
with the Alabama Child Support Guidelines and ORDER Respondent to reimburse Petitioner’s
attorney’s fees incurred as a result of filing this Motion.
Respectfully submitted on December 20, 2024.
/s/ Barbara H. Agricola (AGR004)
Attorney for Petitioner
OF COUNSEL:
AGRICOLA LAW
127 South 8th Street
Opelika, Alabama 36801
Telephone: 334.759.7557
Facsimile: 334.759.7558
barbara@agricolalaw.com
